brief_description: The scheme aims to support fish production among Scheduled Caste/ Scheduled Tribe communities. The scheme offers a 60% subsidy on pond construction and related investments to eligible beneficiaries.
detailed_description: The scheme &quot;Scheduled Tribe/Scheduled Caste Sub Plan&quot; was launched by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Uttarakhand. The objective of the scheme is to promote fish production among Scheduled Caste (SC) and Scheduled Tribe (ST) communities by providing financial assistance for the construction of pond clusters in their villages. Under this scheme, a 60% subsidy is provided on first-year investments such as pond construction, fish fingerlings, and feed to individual beneficiaries and groups belonging to the SC/ST categories.
benefits: For individual SC/ST beneficiaries: Up to ₹3,00,000/- for pond construction of up to 500 cubic meters. For SC/ST Category Committee/Group/ Societies /Federation/Mangal Dal: Up to ₹6,00,000/- for pond construction of up to 1,000 cubic meters. In plain areas, beneficiaries are eligible for a 60% subsidy (amounting to ₹5.10 lakh on the total construction cost of ₹8.50 lakh for a 1-hectare fish pond).
Minimum 10 ponds should be constructed in one village as a cluster. Ponds of 0.05 to 0.50 hectares can be developed in plain areas. 60% of first-year investments (fingerlings and feed) are covered.
Free technical guidance for high-growth fish species. Optional free training in fishery operations.
Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to beneficiary's bank account. In case of loan, through a bank.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) or Scheduled Tribe (ST) category. The applicant should be residing in either hilly or plain areas. The applicant should be interested in fish production or already engaged in it. The applicant (individual or group) should own land or have leased land with access to a reliable water source.

steps: Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Assistant Director Fisheries/District Fisheries In-Charge at the district level and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Assistant Director Fisheries/District Fisheries In-charge at the district level. Post-application Process: Step 1: A fisheries inspector/field officer conducts a site survey and prepares a proposal in collaboration with the applicant. Step 2: The proposal is reviewed and approved by the concerned district fisheries officer. Step 3: Pond construction is carried out under the supervision of field personnel. Technical assistance is provided throughout. Step 4: On completion, based on the work completion certificate, the subsidy is released via DBT. In case of loans, subsidy is disbursed through the bank.

Registration Process: Step 1: Visit to e-Services Apuni Sarkar ( https://eservices.uk.gov.in ) and click "Sign Up" on the Citizen Login page. Step 2: Fill in the registration form with your name, email, mobile number, etc., and click Submit. Step 3: You will receive your User ID and password via SMS on your registered mobile number. Application Process: Step 1: Navigate to the Citizen Login page and enter your User ID (email or mobile) and password, complete the captcha, then click Sign In. Step 2: Once logged in, your dashboard appears. Click "Apply for New Application" or similar to begin. Step 3: Choose the Fisheries department, from the list, select the specific scheme you wish to apply for. Step 4: The portal will list mandatory documents required and upload mandatory documents, after uploading, click Submit to proceed. Step 5: Enter all required details in the form (personal, land, bank, etc.). Use Save to save progress, preview to review, or Delete Draft to reset. Step 6: Once all fields are accurately filled, click Submit. You will receive an Application ID receipt, which you can download. Track Application and Approval: Step 1: The application goes to the concerned department for review. Step 2: You can track your application status on the portal using your Application ID.  User Manual

documents_required: Applicant photograph Aadhaar Card Permanent Residence Certificate Khasra-Khatauni of Land (Land Ownership Document) Bank Account Details/Copy of Front Page of Bank Passbook Mobile Number Group Registration Certificate (in case of group application) Land Availability Certificate (if land is not owned by the applicant but is accessible) Photograph of pond construction site Caste Certificate
